summary: This mod will add sweat or water particles to your character, making it more realistic and sexy! It\'s perfect for taking screenshots, and will add that extra touch of immersion when swimming or even walking around a tropical skyrim!
descriptionHtml:
[b] [center] ========================================================================================================== [/b] [/center]

[b] [center] Description [/b] [/center]
This mod takes the ever-popular Sporty Sexy Sweat mod, and makes it for Males! Your character will have a sexy glistening wet skin which will enhance the realism, sexiness and all the fine details of the skin. ENB\'s will enhance the look even more, resulting in amazing and sexy characters, perfect for everything from screenshots to building a house and even running around the island of Solstheim or a tropical skyrim!
The original mod (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28946/) was created by xs2reality! 
[b] [center] ========================================================================================================== [/b] [/center]

[center] [b] Mods I Used in the Screenshots: [/center] [/b]

Better Sundracon Meshes: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26145

Fine Face Textures by Urshi: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27815

The Well-Dressed Mage by Earrindo: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29469

BFG Better FaceGen by Radioragae: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/6953

[i] To get your character to look just like mine, you will have to use the above mods! [/i]

[i] Thank you to Neishia and Av1dpup1l for uploading screenshots! [/i]

[b] [center] ========================================================================================================== [/b] [/center]

[center] [b] INSTALLATION: [/b] [/center]

[b] With NMM: [/b]

1. Click \'Download with Manager\' button
2. If the NMM doesn\'t open up, do so
3. Activate the Mod

[b] Manual: [/b]

1. Drag the data folder to where you installed Skyrim.
2. Click \"Merge\" if on Windows
3. Click \"Replace\" and replace all of the 
[b] [center] ========================================================================================================== [/b] [/center]

[center] [b] FAQ: [/center] [/b]

Q: Why does the sweat appear white like c******* (cookie glacing lol)?
A: A specular map can only emit shine in one color which is set in the body mesh, in our case: white. With moderate specularity settings it should look similar to water; only reflective with a light source under a certain direction. However when these settings are too high, it will appear white. See ENB tweaking for more info.

Q: What is this mod?
A: This mod is only a \'shine texture\' and doesn\'t contain little information how your body actually looks like in game. It doesn\'t make your character nude or muscular, only shiny!

Q: What the heck is a specular map?
A: A specular map allows an additional lighting per pixel enabling a shiny effect on game models. This mod uses it to create a diffuse gloss on the entire body as well as some drops and streams of sweat or water.

Q: What can I do to thank you/xs2reality for creating this wonderful mod?
A: Endorsements are only to rank the mod on the Nexus site. I will always love to see your screenshots to see what everybody is doing with their game. 

[i] Got any more questions? Feel free to message me through the Nexus, I constantly check it, and would be glad to help with any problems or direct you to someone who can fix them! [/i]
[b] [center] ========================================================================================================== [/b] [/center]
 
[center] [b] CREDITS: [/center] [/b]

I would like to thank xs2reality for letting me use his resources
I would like to thank Bethesda for creating Skyrim
I would like to thank the Nexus for existing

Be sure to check out xs2reality for a female version!
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28946/
[b] [center] ========================================================================================================== [/b] [/center]
author: Tito Mead
